page.title: 11JOHN'S CAR-WASH SERVICE
page.content: Some time during 1971,John,who lives in Cambridge Street,cleaned a friend's car inside and out for just 50 pence. In no time at all,word got around,and suddenly John was in business.His own preferred mode of transport is a road- ster bicycle equipped front and rear with wire baskets which carry special- ist polishes,shampoos and other clean- ing gear.During a typical working day he may cycle to Dunstable,Markyate,and other outlying areas to serve his clients who include hairdressers,taxi firms,and company directors.Business falls off in the winter but is good in summer. Until British Rail changed the design of their luggage vans,he would often take his bike on the train to London's West End for the day to attend to the cleaning needs of his more affluent patrons.Enterprise!{N.W.
